sentence.Network_en: Buying budget-priced furniture needn't mean compromising on quality or style.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)a person or thing that has been somewhere so long as to seem a permanent, unquestioned, or invisible feature of the landscape
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)习以为常（或司空见惯）的人（或物）

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (denoting the action of furnishing): from French fourniture, from fournir, from Old French furnir 'to furnish'

entry.def: Furniture consists of large objects such as tables, chairs, or beds that are used in a room for sitting or lying on or for putting things on or in.

example.ex: Each piece of furniture in their home suited the style of the house.
example.tran: 他们家里的每件家具都和房子的风格相得益彰。

entry.tran: 被认作当然的人(或事物);习以为常的人(或事物)
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as part of the furniture, you are suggesting that they have been somewhere such as their place of work for such a long time that it is hard to imagine that place without them.

means.word_mean: 1. furnishings that make a room or other area ready for occupancy;

sentences.sentence: "they had too much furniture for the small apartment"
"there was only one piece of furniture in the room"

example.en: There' re some people who often pick up street furniture on the street.
